post_text:
Happy Tuesday!
We hope you are all enjoying your summer and staying safe! ğŸ™‚

Below is the link to our website where you will find our Reopening Protocols for the 2020/2021 school year.
You will also find a letter from our Superintendent, Marty Ofenham, explaining that we will NOT be resuming school on July 27th, as originally planned. Instead, we will start school on August 19th for the 2020/2021 school year.
These letters are being mailed to each family today, so you will soon have your own copy explaining what the upcoming school year is going to look like.

As always, please let us know if you have any questions or concerns. Our staff is diligently working on creating the safest school year for every student.
www.meridiantigers.com

Hello Meridian Tigers!
Distance Learning is officially ending for MES on May 20th. Below you will find the link to a letter from our Superintendent, Marty Ofenham, explaining how we are handling the rest of the school year and what the beginning of next school year will look like.
As always, please reach out if you have any questions or comments.
We look forward to seeing you all on Friday, May 22nd when we pick up your packets/Chromebooks.
Have a wonderful weekend! ğŸ™‚ğŸ¯

Meridian Elementary School will now be closed through May 1st.
Below is a letter from our Superintendent, Marty Ofenham, explaining our decision. The MES staff is currently working on a distance-learning curriculum and we will keep you updated as we build this program.
Also, due to lack of participation the meal service has ended.
Please reach out if you have any questions! Stay safe and healthy! ğŸ™‚

Meridian Elementary School WILL be closed from March 17th-April 13th. Below is a letter from our Superintendent, Marty Ofenham, explaining our decision and giving helpful resources to all families.
We look forward to our students returning to school on Tuesday, April 14th!

post_text:
Meridian Elementary School WILL be in session, while we continue to closely monitor the COVID-19 and we will continue to be in communication with all of our families. Currently, we do NOT have an identified case of COVID-19 in Yuba or Sutter County.
Below you will see a letter from our Superintendent, Marty Ofenham, keeping you informed on our decision. You will also see a letter from Dr. Luu, the Bi-County Health Officer, explaining our course of action.
Please let us know if you have any questions.
